catalog_info.title: Gods and Giants in the French Renaissance
catalog_info.description: In this course we will study the “supersized agency” of gods and giants in 16th-century French literature. Keeping an eye on the relevance of such agencies in the age of the Anthropocene (where “we” are “giants”), we will trace the fuzzy boundaries between gods, giants, and humans. The first half of the course will focus on two “good” giants (Gargantua, Pantagruel) and one “bad” one (Goliath). The second half will focus on the post-classical survival of several Pagan gods (Jupiter, Juno, Neptune, etc.).  Readings: Cicero, Des Masures, Du Bellay, Rabelais, Ronsard, etc. as well as contemporary theory.
